content:
Here is the breakdown of sales needed to achieve various percentages of the total addressable market, ranging from 0.25% to 5%, based on the low and high estimates of the addressable market:
**0.25% of the addressable market:**
Low estimate (354,000):
0.25% of 354,000 = 885 sales
High estimate (444,125):
0.25% of 444,125 = 1,110.3125 sales (round up to 1,111 sales)
**1% of the addressable market:**
Low estimate (354,000):
1% of 354,000 = 3,540 sales
High estimate (444,125):
1% of 444,125 = 4,441.25 sales (round up to 4,442 sales)
**2% of the addressable market:**
Low estimate (354,000):
2% of 354,000 = 7,080 sales
High estimate (444,125):
2% of 444,125 = 8,882.5 sales (round up to 8,883 sales)
**3% of the addressable market:**
Low estimate (354,000):
3% of 354,000 = 10,620 sales
High estimate (444,125):
3% of 444,125 = 13,323.75 sales (round up to 13,324 sales)
**4% of the addressable market:**
Low estimate (354,000):
4% of 354,000 = 14,160 sales
High estimate (444,125):
4% of 444,125 = 17,765 sales
**5% of the addressable market:**
Low estimate (354,000):
5% of 354,000 = 17,700 sales
High estimate (444,125):
5% of 444,125 = 22,206.25 sales (round up to 22,207 sales)
This breakdown provides an overview of the number of sales needed to achieve various percentages of the total addressable market, ranging from 0.25% to 5%.
